```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(tidyverse)
library(glmnet)
```

## Try Lasso


import and clean birthweight data

```{r}
bwt_df = 
  read_csv("data/birthweight.csv") |> 
  mutate(
    babysex = 
          case_match(babysex,
                     1 ~ "male",
                     2 ~ "female"),
    babysex = fct_infreq(babysex),
    frace = 
          case_match(frace,
              1 ~ "white",
              2 ~ "black", 
              3 ~ "asian", 
              4 ~ "puerto rican", 
              8 ~ "other"),
    frace = fct_infreq(frace),
    mrace = 
        case_match(mrace,
            1 ~ "white",
            2 ~ "black", 
            3 ~ "asian", 
            4 ~ "puerto rican",
            8 ~ "other"),
    mrace = fct_infreq(mrace),
    malform = as.logical(malform))|> 
  sample_n(200)
    
  
  
```

Construct inputs for `glmnet`

```{r}
x = model.matrix(bwt ~ ., data = bwt_df)[,-1]
y = bwt_df |> pull(bwt)
```

Fit lasso for several lambdas

```{r}
lambda = 10^seq(-2,2.75, by = 0.1)

lasso_fit = 
  glmnet(x = x, y = y, lambda = lambda)
```

Usual lasso plot

```{r}
lasso_fit |> 
  broom::tidy() |> 
  filter(term != "(Intercept)") |> 
  select(term, lambda, estimate) |> 
  complete(term, lambda, fill = list(estimate = 0)) |> view()
  ggplot(aes(x = lambda, y = estimate, group = term, color = term)) +
  geom_line()
```
